sentences.english: George enjoys talking about people’s private affairs. He is a gossip. (2003.9)
sentences.chinese: 乔治喜欢谈论别人的私事，他是个爱说长道短的人。

sentences.english: Please do not interfere in my private affairs.
Don’t confound public affairs with private ones.
sentences.chinese: 不要把公事与私事混为一谈。

sentences.english: She likes to pry into private affairs of others.
sentences.chinese: 她喜欢打听别人的私事。

sentences.english: Let's get Garfield in for his dip. I wanna talk to you in private.
sentences.chinese: 我们把加菲留在这儿一会，我有点私事想和你谈谈。

sentences.english: Private Affair Leave means the time that the employee does not go to the post in legal working days because of private affairs.
sentences.chinese: 是指因个人私事在法定工日未到岗工作的时间。

sentences.english: A good employee has a clear line between business and private affairs.
sentences.chinese: 一名优秀的员工会把公事与私事清楚地划分开来。

sentences.english: It's a private matter. He decides.
sentences.chinese: 被冒犯的一方，由于是私事，所以由他自己决定。

sentences.english: Focus on your work tasks and limit personal discussions to lunch works or after working hours.
sentences.chinese: 专注于工作，谈私事得在午饭时间或者下班时间。

sentences.english: She tattled on her estranged husband.
sentences.chinese: 她在背后谈论与她分居的丈夫的私事。

sentences.english: By contrast, French political scandals are rarely about the personal predilections of public men.
sentences.chinese: 相比之下，法国的政治丑闻很少关于公众人物的私事。

sentences.english: There is a privacy I love in this snowy night.
sentences.chinese: 这个雪夜里有件我所喜爱的私事。

sentences.english: TYPICAL USE:The gifts of charity meddled with a gentleman's private affair.
sentences.chinese: 慈善礼物干扰一位绅士的私事。

sentences.english: She is hostile to people who go poking into her private affairs.
sentences.chinese: 她非常讨厌那些探听她私事的人。
我们不该打听他人的私事。

sentences.english: This kind of person is interested in other people's private matters. He is considered nosey .
sentences.chinese: 这种人对别人的私事很感兴趣，人们认为他好管闲事。

definition: to show an interest in/to get involved with
to be occupied with sth/to have sth on one's mind/there is something the matter
(political, economic etc) affairs/work/transaction (as in a computer database)
to force someone to do something
to discuss sth on its own merits/to judge the matter as it stands
one's employment/business/matter that needs to be settled/(northern dialect) (of a person) demanding/trying/troublesome/erhua variant of 事[shi4]/CL:件[jian4],樁|桩[zhuang1]
